title: Authors and Citation
text: Eisenhauer C (2024). epitracing: Tools visualize assess transmission networks. R package version 0.0.0.9000.
code: @Manual{,   title = {epitracing: Tools to visualize and assess transmission networks},   author = {Catherine Eisenhauer},   year = {2024},   note = {R package version 0.0.0.9000}, }

title: Example Case Data — example_cases
text: example (minimal) linelist individual case data. data fake intended represent particular pathogen.

title: Example Case Data — example_cases
text: data frame 13 rows 6 columns: id Case id adm3 Administrative district outcome Exit status date_symptoms Date symptom onset date_hospital Date hospitalization date_outcome Date case outcome (discharged died)

title: Example Infector-Infectee Pair Data — example_pairs
text: example (minimal) dataset infector-infectee pairs corresponding casees.

title: Example Infector-Infectee Pair Data — example_pairs
text: data frame 13 rows 2 columns: id Case id infector_id Infector id

what: Map Secondaries of a Case — map_case
title: Map Secondaries of a Case — map_case
text: Internal function calculates visual order secondaries single case.

title: Map Secondaries of a Case — map_case
code: map_case(   case_id,   order_id,   cases,   var_id = "id",   var_infector = "infector_id",   verbose = FALSE )

title: Map Secondaries of a Case — map_case
text: case_id chr Case map. order_id int Case order dataset. cases df Data frame case data. var_id chr Column name case id. var_infector chr Column name infector id. verbose bool Whether print output cases mapped.

title: Map Order of Cases — map_cases
text: Internal function calculates visual order position cases linear excel output.

title: Map Order of Cases — map_cases
code: map_cases(   cases,   var_id = "id",   var_infector = "infector_id",   var_order = "date_symptoms",   verbose = FALSE )

title: Map Order of Cases — map_cases
text: cases df Data frame case data. var_id chr Column name case id. var_infector chr Column name infector id. var_order chr Column name variable used visually order cases. verbose bool Whether print output cases mapped.

title: Plot Linear Chains (ggplot2) — plot_chains_linear
text: Plots transmission trees linear layout, showing infections case progression time. default cases ordered date symptom onset, starting top left bottom right. Note function expects case data column indicating id infector, pairs stored separate dataset, must join first.

title: Plot Linear Chains (ggplot2) — plot_chains_linear
code: plot_chains_linear(   cases,   height = 5,   gap = height/2,   offset = 1,   var_id = "id",   var_infector = "infector_id",   var_order = var_symptoms,   var_symptoms = "date_symptoms",   var_transition = "date_hospital",   var_outcome = "date_outcome",   fill_infected = "#EEEEEE",   fills_outcome = c("#000000", "#819CBB"),   color_links = "#000000",   date_breaks = "1 week" )

title: Plot Linear Chains (ggplot2) — plot_chains_linear
text: cases df Dataframe case information. dataset contain information outcome, onset date, transition (hospitalization) date, outcome date, infector. height num Height bars representing cases. gap num Gap bars. offset num Offset beginning bar link connecting secondary cases. var_id chr Column name case id. var_infector chr Column name infector id. var_order chr Column name variable used visually order cases. var_symptoms chr Column name symptom onset date. var_transition chr Column name transition (hospitalization) date. var_outcome chr Colun name outcome date. fill_infected chr Color use initial infected period bar. fills_outcome chr vct Colors use second part bar, indicating outcome. color_links chr Color lines linking primary secondary cases. date_breaks chr Breaks use date axis.

title: Plot Linear Chains (ggplot2) — plot_chains_linear
code: cases <- left_join(example_cases, example_pairs) # add infector information #> Joining with `by = join_by(id)` plot_chains_linear(cases) #> Joining with `by = join_by(infector_id)` #> Joining with `by = join_by(infector_id, id)` #> Warning: Removed 2 rows containing missing values (`geom_segment()`). #> Warning: Removed 2 rows containing missing values (`geom_segment()`).
